Jan Plestenjak iskren kot še nikoli: Velikokrat se počutim res bedno ...
V pogovorni oddaji je priznal marsikaj.
03 Nov 2019, 17:13 by P. K.
V priljubljeni pogovorni oddaji na nacionalni televiziji, ki jo vodi Ana Tavčar Pirkovič, so govorili o osamljenosti, samoti, samosti in samskosti. V oddaji so o tej temi spregovorili Ivana Šundov, Jan Plestenjak in Bruno Šimleša.Plestenjak je odkrito govoril o tem, kako doživlja samoto in osamljenost, ter priznal, da se včasih vpraša, kako mu pri 46 letih še ni uspelo ustvariti doma. Povedal je tudi, da je v preteklosti življenje zajemal z veliko žlico in preizkusil marsikaj.​​Najpomembnejša začimba življenja pa je zanj strast. Po vprašanju Tavčarjeve, kako se počuti, ko spelje kakšen koncert, je priznal, da se dan po uspešnem nastopu počuti bedno in praznega. Na vseh nastopih da vse od sebe in to zahteva veliko energije. »Lahko bi se manj razdajal na odru, a bi tudi ljudje manj uživali,« je povedal priljubljeni pevec. Priznal je, da se včasih zasmili sam sebi, vendar ta občutek ne traja prav dolgo, saj se zaveda, v kakšnih stiskah živijo nekateri ljudje, ki komaj pridejo skozi mesec ali pa so hudo bolni.

Jan Plestenjak honest as never before: Many times I feel really miserable ...
He acknowledged many things in the talk show.
03 Nov 2019, 17:13 by P.K.
A popular talk show on national television hosted by Ana Tavcar Pirkovic talked about loneliness, solitude, solitude and loneliness. Ivan Šundov, Jan Plestenjak and Bruno Šimleša spoke on the topic. Pestenjak spoke openly about experiencing loneliness and loneliness, and admitted that he sometimes wondered how he had failed to make it at home at 46. He also said that in the past he took his life with a big spoon and tried many things, but his most important spice of life was his passion. Asked how he feels when he performs a concert, he admitted that he feels miserable and empty the day after a successful performance. He does his best in all appearances and it takes a lot of energy. "I could do less onstage, but people would enjoy it less," said the popular singer. He admitted that he sometimes laughed at himself, but that feeling does not last very long, as he is aware of the hardship some people who barely get through the month or who are seriously ill live in.
